title: How to Fold (Baking)

steps.headline: Follow the recipe's instructions properly.
steps.description: Folding usually occurs after you have already mixed the mixtures separately in their own containers. While this means more work and dishes, it also means a better end result, so it's worth doing what the recipe asks!

steps.headline: Use a metallic spoon or a rubber spatula.
steps.description: The thinness of either implement is important for making it easier to fold correctly.

steps.headline: Add the delicate mixture to the heavy mixture.
steps.description: Never do this the other way around, so as to avoid the risk of overwhelming the delicate mixture, and potentially bursting air bubbles, or causing other overwhelming reactions.

steps.headline: Use the metallic spoon or spatula in a cutting action.
steps.description: Cut down through the center of the two mixtures and bring the heavy mixture back up to the top. Baking 911 explains this as the: "down-across-up-and-over motion", which explains it well. Turn the bowl as you are doing this, to ensure that the folding is evenly distributed. Do not stir!

steps.headline: Continue until both mixtures are adequately combined.
steps.description: See "Tips" for avoiding over- or under-folding.
